title: Ticket #732: Config file filenames are case-sensitive on Windows
description:
When reading the config files and tracking which files have already been read, Condor treats the filenames as case-sensitive on both Windows and unix. On Windows, they should be case-insensitive.

In the rust ticket, the user's config files defined LOCAL_DIR twice, once as C:\condor and once as C:\Condor. This resulted in one local config file being read twice, the second time out of order.
creator: jfrey
